text:
Hey, sure, so here's what I would do:
I would first of all delete all those lights, it's tempting to have lots of them but in realistic lighting less is more. 
Then, if by any chance you have a grey sphere or anything grey really (of course you need to know it's grey for sure) in plate, I would try to match to that and then just transfer the lighting. I don't think your lighting is that bad but it's just over exposed. Now if you want to make it one to one to plate you need to make it darker and remove all directional looking lights. Though I wouldn't go that far. You can leave one or two supportive lights but not more. Try to play with 2 sources, hdri and area, and only when you're happy at third one
thanks so much man we will give it a go
sadly we didnt have a grey ball on set as our loan store didnt have one but we can try with somthing in the plate
